segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks outside the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden is so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes, completely unaware of the water spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are about to cause a big mess, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s going to tip any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her cookie, not noticing the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be really upset when she finally turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still overflowing, and the floor is getting more and more slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long this can go on before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is like watching a slow-motion accident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I don’t know if they’d listen.
segments.speaker: PAR
